name: Wupatki National Monument
description: Nestled between the Painted Desert and ponderosa highlands of northern Arizona, Wupatki National Monument is an unlikely landscape for a thriving community. The early 1100's marked a time of cooler and wetter weather, when the ancestors of contemporary Pueblo communities created a bustling center of trade and culture. For indigenous peoples, these sites represent the footprints of their ancestors.
shortDescription: Nestled between the Painted Desert and ponderosa highlands of northern Arizona, Wupatki National Monument is an unlikely landscape for a thriving community. The early 1100's marked a time of cooler an...

operatingHours.description:
The Wupatki National Monument Visitor Center is open 9:00AM to 4:30PM MST March 8th- November 1st. The visitor center is closed Tuesdays through Thursdays November 2nd- march 7th and is closed for December 25th and January 1st. 

Trails to Wupatki, Wukoki, Citadel, Nalakihu, Box Canyon, and Lomaki Pueblos are open daily from sunrise to sunset.

fees.title: Entrance - Private Vehicle
fees.description: This fee covers the occupants of one private vehicle for seven days at both Sunset Crater Volcano and Wupatki National Monuments.

fees.title: Entrance - Motorcycle
fees.description: Valid for 7 days. Admits up to 2 private, non-commercial motorcycles with up to 4 total passengers to both Sunset Crater Volcano and Wupatki National Monuments.

fees.title: Entrance - Per Person
fees.description: This fee covers entry for one bicyclist or pedestrian for seven days at both Sunset Crater Volcano and Wupatki National Monuments.

fees.title: Entrance - Non-commercial Groups
fees.description: Non-commercial groups are charged the per-person entrance fee of $15 for all persons 16yrs and over, not to exceed the commercial rate for the size of vehicle entering the monument.

fees.title: Entrance - Education/Academic Groups
fees.description: Educational groups visiting the monument for a curriculum related visit should apply for an Academic Fee Waiver. If no fee waiver is obtained, educational groups will be charged as non-commercial groups.

fees.title: Commercial Entrance - Sedan
fees.description: This fee covers the occupants of one commercial sedan for one day at both Sunset Crater Volcano and Wupatki National Monuments.

fees.title: Commercial Entrance - Van
fees.description: This fee covers the occupants of one commercial van for one day at both Sunset Crater Volcano and Wupatki National Monuments.

fees.title: Commercial Entrance - Motor Coach
fees.description: This fee covers the occupants of one commercial bus for one day at both Sunset Crater Volcano and Wupatki National Monuments.

climate.weatherDescription: Be prepared for variable and extreme weather conditions. You may expect high winds any time of year, summer temperatures above 100ºF (38ºC), afternoon thunderstorms July–September, and occasional snow in winter and early spring. Dress in layers, as Wupatki weather can change quickly at any time of year. For current weather please visit https://www.nps.gov/wupa/planyourvisit/weather.htm

images.title: Wupatki Pueblo
images.altText: a large stone pueblo in a desert beneath mostly sunny skies with mountains in background
images.caption: Wupatki, the monument's namesake pueblo, is made up of more than 100 rooms. The trail also features an ancient ball court and natural blowhole.

images.title: Wukoki Pueblo
images.altText: a man and woman walking toward a three-story sandstone tower
images.caption: Wukoki Pueblo is located three miles from the Wupatki Visitor Center.

images.title: Lomaki Pueblo
images.altText: Walls of a white limestone and red sandstone structure under light blue skies with white clouds.
images.caption: Lomaki means "beautiful house" in the Hopi language. The pueblo is located ten miles from the visitor center and is reachable via a short, 0.5 mile trail.

images.title: Dark Skies over the Desert
images.altText: stars and the Milky Way galaxy over a desert juniper tree
images.caption: Wupatki National Monument features exceptionally dark night skies and hosts numerous star parties each year.

images.title: Citadel Pueblo
images.altText: Side view of the Nalakihu and Citadel Pueblos
images.caption: The Citadel Pueblo sits atop a small cinder hill overlooking the surrounding grasslands.
